translation: The word of the LORD that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam son of Joash, king of Israel.

The beginning of the word of the LORD by Hosea: And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take for yourself a wife of whoredom and children of whoredom, for the land surely commits great whoredom, departing from the LORD.
So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim; and she conceived and bore him a son.
And the LORD said to me, Call his name Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will visit the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu, and I will bring to an end the kingdom of the house of Israel.
And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.
And she conceived again and bore a daughter, and He said to him, “Call her name Lo-ruhamah, for I will no more again have mercy upon the house of Israel, but I will surely take them away.”
But on the house of Judah I will have mercy, and I will save them by the LORD their God; and I will not save them by bow, nor by sword, nor by battle, by horses, nor by horsemen.
And when she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
And He said, Call his name Lo-ammi, for you are not My people, and I will not be yours.

And the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured nor counted; and it shall be, in the place where it was said to them, You are not My people, it shall be said to them, Children of the living God.
And the children of Judah and the children of Israel shall be gathered together, and they shall appoint for themselves one head, and they shall go up from the land, for great is the day of Jezreel.
Say to your brothers, “My people,” and to your sisters, “Shown mercy.”
Contend with your mother, contend, for she is not my wife, and I am not her husband; and let her remove her whorings from before my face, and her adulteries from between her breasts.
Lest I strip her naked and set her as in the day she was born, and make her as the wilderness, and render her like a parched land, and slay her with thirst.
And upon her children I will not have mercy, for they are children of whoredoms.

For their mother has played the harlot; she who conceived them has acted shamefully. For she said, “I will go after my lovers, who give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.”
Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns, and I will wall up her fence, and her paths she shall not find.

And she shall pursue her lovers, but shall not overtake them; and she shall seek them, but shall not find them. Then she shall say, “I will go and return to my first husband, for it was better for me then than now.”
But she did not know that it was I who gave her the grain and the new wine and the oil, and I multiplied for her silver and gold, which they used for Baal.
Therefore I will return and take back my grain in its time, and my new wine in its season, and I will snatch away my wool and my flax, which were to cover her nakedness.
And now I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, and no man shall deliver her out of my hand.
And I will cause all her mirth to cease, her feast, her new moon, and her sabbath, and all her appointed times.

And I will make desolate her vine and her fig tree, of which she has said, “They are my hire, which my lovers have given me;” and I will make them a thicket, and the beast of the field shall devour them.

And I will visit upon her the days of the Baals, to whom she burned incense, when she decked herself with her nose ring and her jewels, and went after her lovers, but Me she forgot, declares the LORD.
Therefore, behold, I will allure her, and will lead her into the wilderness, and will speak to her heart.

And I will give to her her vineyards from there, and the Valley of Achor for a door of hope; and she shall answer there, as in the days of her youth, and as in the day of her coming up out of the land of Egypt.
And it shall be in that day, declares the LORD, that you will call Me, “My Husband,” and will no more call Me, “My Baal.”
And I will take away the names of the Baals from her mouth, and they shall be remembered by their name no more.

And in that day I will cut for them a covenant with the beast of the field and with the bird of the heavens and with the creeping thing of the ground; and bow and sword and war I will break from the land, and I will make them lie down in safety.
And I will betroth you to Me forever; yes, I will betroth you to Me in righteousness and in justice, and in lovingkindness and in mercies.
And I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness, and you shall know the LORD.
And it shall come to pass in that day, declares the LORD, I will answer the heavens, and they shall answer the earth.
And the earth shall answer the grain and the new wine and the fresh oil, and they shall answer Jezreel.
And I will sow her for Myself in the land, and I will have mercy on Not‑Pitied, and I will say to Not‑My‑People, You are My people; and he shall say, My God.

And the LORD said to me, “Go again, love a woman loved by a companion and an adulteress, even as the love of the LORD toward the children of Israel, while they are turning to other gods and loving raisin cakes.”
So I bought her for myself for fifteen pieces of silver, and a homer of barley and a lethech of barley.
And I said to her, You shall abide for me many days; you shall not play the harlot, and you shall not belong to any man; and I also will be so toward you.
For the children of Israel shall sit many days without king and without prince, and without sacrifice and without pillar, and without ephod and household gods.
Afterward the children of Israel shall return and seek the LORD their God and David their king, and they shall come in awe to the LORD and to His goodness in the latter days.

Hear the word of the LORD, O children of Israel, for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because there is no truth, and no lovingkindness, and no knowledge of God in the land.
Swearing and lying and murdering and stealing and committing adultery break forth, and blood touches blood.
Therefore the land shall mourn, and everyone who dwells in it shall languish, with the beasts of the field and the birds of the heavens; yes, the fish of the sea also shall be taken away.
Yet let no man contend, and let no man reprove; for your people are as those who strive with the priest.
And you shall stumble by day, and the prophet also shall stumble with you by night; and I will destroy your mother.

My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge; because you have rejected knowledge, I also will reject you from being priest to Me. Since you have forgotten the law of your God, I also will forget your children.
As they multiplied, so they sinned against Me; I will exchange their glory for shame.
They feed on the sin of My people, and to their iniquity they lift up their soul.
And it shall be, like people, like priest; and I will visit upon him his ways, and his deeds I will return upon him.
They shall eat and not be satisfied; they have committed harlotry and shall not increase, because they have forsaken the LORD, to keep Him.
Harlotry and wine and new wine take away the heart.
My people inquire of their piece of wood, and their staff declares to them; for a spirit of whoredom has led them astray, and they have played the harlot from under their God.

On the tops of the mountains they sacrifice, and on the hills they burn incense, under oak and poplar and terebinth, because their shade is good; therefore your daughters commit harlotry, and your brides commit adultery.

I will not punish your daughters when they play the harlot, nor your brides when they commit adultery; for they themselves go aside with harlots, and with temple prostitutes they sacrifice, and a people without understanding shall be cast down.
Though you play the harlot, O Israel, let not Judah become guilty; and do not come to Gilgal, and do not go up to Beth-aven, and do not swear, “As the LORD lives.”
For like a stubborn heifer has Israel been stubborn; now shall the LORD pasture them like a lamb in a broad place.
Ephraim is joined to idols; leave him alone.
Their drink is gone; they have surely played the harlot; they love, “Bring!”—their shields are given to shame.
The wind has bound her up in its wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Hear this, O priests; give ear, O house of Israel; and hearken, O house of the king, for judgment is for you, because you have been a snare at Mizpah and a net spread upon Tabor.
And the revolters have gone deep in slaughter, but I am a rebuke to them all.
I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hidden from Me; for now, O Ephraim, you have played the harlot, Israel is defiled.
Their deeds will not permit them to return to their God, for a spirit of whoredom is within them, and they have not known the LORD.
The pride of Israel testifies to his face, and Israel and Ephraim shall stumble in their iniquity; Judah also has stumbled with them.
With their flocks and with their herds they shall go to seek the LORD, but they shall not find Him; He has withdrawn Himself from them.
They have dealt treacherously against the LORD, for they have begotten strange children; now a month shall devour them with their portions.
Blow the shofar in Gibeah, the trumpet in Ramah; cry aloud at Beth-aven: after you, O Benjamin.
Ephraim shall be for desolation in the day of rebuke; among the tribes of Israel I have made known what is sure.
The princes of Judah are like those who move a boundary; upon them I will pour out my wrath like water.
Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment, because he willingly walked after command.
But I am like a moth to Ephraim, and like rottenness to the house of Judah.
When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his wound, then Ephraim went to Assyria and sent to the great king; yet he is not able to heal you, nor shall he cure you of your wound.
For I will be like a lion to Ephraim, and like a young lion to the house of Judah; I, even I, will tear and go away, I will carry off, and none shall deliver.
I will go, I will return to My place, until they are guilty and seek My face; in their distress they will earnestly seek Me.
Come, and let us return to the LORD, for He has torn, and He will heal us; He has struck, and He will bind us up.
He will revive us after two days; on the third day He will raise us up, and we shall live before Him.
And let us know, let us press on to know the LORD; his going forth is sure as the dawn, and he will come to us like the rain, like the latter rain that waters the earth.
What shall I do to you, O Ephraim? What shall I do to you, O Judah? For your loyalty is like a morning cloud, and like the dew that early passes away.
Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets, I have slain them by the words of My mouth, and My judgments shall go forth as the light.
For I desire mercy and not sacrifice, and the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
But they, like Adam, have transgressed the covenant; there they have dealt treacherously against Me.
Gilead is a city of workers of iniquity, tracked with blood.
And like bands of men lying in wait, a company of priests murder on the way to Shechem; for they have committed wickedness.
In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing; there is harlotry in Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also for you, O Judah, a harvest is appointed, when I restore the fortunes of My people.
When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, and the evils of Samaria; for they have wrought falsehood, and the thief comes in, a band of robbers raids outside.
And they do not say in their heart that I remember all their evil; now their own deeds have encircled them, they are before my face.
With their evil they make the king glad, and with their lies the princes.
All of them are adulterers, like an oven heated by the baker, who ceases stirring from the kneading of the dough until it is leavened.
On the day of our king the princes became sick with the heat of wine; he stretched out his hand with the mockers.
For they have drawn near; like an oven is their heart in their ambush. All the night their baker sleeps; in the morning it burns like a flaming fire.
All of them are hot like an oven, and they devour their judges; all their kings have fallen—there is none among them that calls upon Me.
Ephraim mixes himself among the peoples; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
Strangers have devoured his strength, yet he does not know it; also gray hairs are sprinkled upon him, yet he does not know.
The pride of Israel testifies to his face, yet they have not returned to the LORD their God, nor have they sought Him in all this.
And Ephraim has become like a simple dove without understanding; they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
As they go, I will spread my net over them; I will bring them down like the birds of the heavens; I will chasten them according to the report given to their assembly.
Woe to them, for they have wandered from Me; devastation to them, for they have rebelled against Me. Though I would redeem them, yet they have spoken lies against Me.
And they have not cried to Me with their heart, but they wail upon their beds; for grain and new wine they assemble themselves, they turn away from Me.
And I myself disciplined and strengthened their arms, yet against Me they devise evil.
They return, but not to the Most High; they have become like a deceitful bow. Their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue; this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Put the trumpet to your mouth; like an eagle it comes against the house of the LORD, because they have transgressed my covenant and rebelled against my law.
To me they cry, My God, we, Israel, know you.
Israel has spurned the good; the enemy shall pursue him.
They have set up kings, but not by Me; they have made princes, and I did not know it. Of their silver and their gold they have made idols for themselves, that they may be cut off.
Your calf is cast off, O Samaria; my anger is kindled against them. How long will they be incapable of innocence?
For from Israel is it also; the craftsman made it, and it is no God. For the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.
For they sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind; a stalk that has no standing grain, it yields no flour; and if it should yield, strangers shall swallow it up.
Israel is swallowed up; now they are among the nations like a vessel in which there is no delight.
For they have gone up to Assyria, a wild donkey wandering by itself; Ephraim has hired lovers.
Even though they hire lovers among the nations, now will I gather them; and they shall soon writhe under the burden of the king of princes.
Because Ephraim has multiplied altars for sinning, altars have become to him for sinning.
Though I write for him the myriads of My law, they are counted as a strange thing.
As for the sacrifices of My gifts, they sacrifice flesh and eat it, but the LORD does not accept them. Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins; they shall return to Egypt.
Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces, and Judah has multiplied fortified cities; but I will send a fire upon his cities, and it shall devour her strongholds.
Do not rejoice, O Israel, exult not like the peoples, for you have played the harlot, departing from your God; you have loved a harlot’s hire upon every threshing floor of grain.
The threshing floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail her.
They shall not dwell in the land of the LORD, but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and in Assyria they shall eat what is unclean.

They shall not pour out wine to the LORD, nor shall their sacrifices be pleasing to Him; like bread of mourners shall they be to them, all who eat of it shall be defiled, for their bread is for their own appetite, it shall not come into the house of the LORD.
What will you do in the day of the appointed time, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
For behold, they are gone away because of destruction; Egypt shall gather them, Memphis shall bury them. Nettles shall possess their precious silver; thorns shall be in their tents.

The days of visitation have come, the days of recompense have come; Israel shall know it. The prophet is a fool, the man of the spirit is mad, because of the greatness of your iniquity and great is the hostility.
Ephraim is a watchman with my God; the prophet is a fowler’s snare on all his ways, hostility in the house of his God.
They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah; he will remember their iniquity, he will punish their sins.

Like grapes in the wilderness I found Israel; like the first ripe fruit on the fig tree in its beginning I saw your fathers. They came to Baal-peor and consecrated themselves to the shameful thing, and became abominable like that which they loved.
Ephraim—like a bird their glory shall fly away, from birth, and from the womb, and from conception.
For though they bring up their children, yet I will bereave them of man; for woe also to them when I turn away from them.
Ephraim, as I have seen, is like Tyre planted in a meadow; but Ephraim is brought out to the slayer of children.
Give them, O LORD—what will you give? Give them a miscarrying womb and withered breasts.
All their wickedness is in Gilgal, for there I began to hate them; because of the evil of their deeds I will drive them out of My house. I will love them no more; all their princes are rebellious.
Ephraim is stricken, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit; even though they give birth, I will slay the cherished ones of their womb.
My God will cast them away, for they did not listen to Him, and they shall be wanderers among the nations.

Israel is a luxuriant vine that brings forth fruit for himself; according to the abundance of his fruit he has multiplied the altars, according to the goodness of his land they have made the pillars good.
Their heart is divided; now shall they be found guilty. He shall break down their altars, he shall destroy their pillars.
For now they will say, “We have no king, for we have not feared the LORD; and the king—what could he do for us?”
They speak mere words, swearing false oaths, cutting covenants; thus judgment springs up like hemlock in the furrows of the field.
The inhabitants of Samaria shall tremble for the calves of Beth-aven; for its people shall mourn over it, and its priests who rejoiced over it, for its glory, because it has departed from them.
It also shall be carried to Assyria as a tribute to the great king; Ephraim shall be seized with shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
Samaria is brought to silence, her king is like foam upon the face of the waters.
The high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed; thorn and thistle shall grow up on their altars, and they shall say to the mountains, “Cover us,” and to the hills, “Fall on us.”
From the days of Gibeah you have sinned, O Israel; there they have stood. Shall not the battle in Gibeah overtake them against the children of iniquity?
When I desire, I will chasten them, and peoples shall be gathered against them, when they are bound for their two transgressions.
And Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh; but I have passed over the fairness of her neck. I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow, Jacob shall break his clods.
Sow for yourselves in righteousness, reap according to mercy; break up for yourselves fallow ground, for it is time to seek the LORD, until He comes and rains righteousness upon you.
You have plowed wickedness, you have reaped injustice, you have eaten the fruit of lies; because you have trusted in your own way, in the multitude of your mighty men.
And tumult shall arise among your people, and all your strongholds shall be laid waste, as Shalman laid waste Beth-arbel in the day of battle; the mother was dashed in pieces with the children.
Thus shall Bethel do to you because of the wickedness of your wickedness; at dawn the king of Israel shall be utterly cut off.
When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and out of Egypt I called My son.
The more they were called, the more they went from before them; to the Baals they sacrificed, and to carved images they burned incense.
Yet it was I who taught Ephraim to walk; I took them up in My arms, but they did not know that I healed them.
With cords of a man I drew them, with bands of love; and I was to them as those who lift the yoke from upon their jaws, and I gently bent down to feed them.
He shall not return to the land of Egypt, but Assyria shall be his king, because they refused to return.
And the sword shall rage in his cities, and shall consume his bars, and devour because of their own counsels.
My people are hung upon their turning away from me; though they call them upward to the Most High, together they do not lift themselves up.
How shall I give you up, Ephraim? How shall I surrender you, Israel? How shall I make you like Admah? Shall I set you as Zeboiim? My heart is turned within Me, together My compassions are kindled.
I will not execute the fierceness of my anger, I will not again destroy Ephraim; for I am God and not man, the Holy One in your midst, and I will not come in wrath.
They shall walk after the LORD; like a lion He shall roar, for He indeed shall roar, and the children shall tremble from the west.
They shall come trembling like a bird out of Egypt, and like a dove from the land of Assyria; and I will cause them to dwell in their houses, declares the LORD.
Ephraim has surrounded Me with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit; but Judah still wanders restlessly with God, and with the Holy One is faithful.
Ephraim feeds on wind and pursues the east wind all the day; he multiplies lies and violence, and they cut a covenant with Assyria, and oil is carried into Egypt.
The LORD has a dispute with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his deeds He will repay him.
In the womb he took his brother by the heel, and in his strength he strove with God.
He strove with the angel and prevailed; he wept and pleaded with him. At Bethel he found him, and there he spoke with us.
But the LORD, the God of hosts, the LORD is his memorial.
But as for you, return to your God; keep mercy and justice, and wait on your God continually.
A merchant, in his hand are deceitful balances; he loves to oppress.
And Ephraim said, “Surely I have become rich, I have found power for myself; in all my labors they shall not find in me iniquity that is sin.”
But I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt; I will yet make you dwell in tents, as in the days of the appointed feast.
And I have spoken by the prophets, and I myself have multiplied visions, and by the hand of the prophets I have used similitudes.
If Gilead is iniquity, surely they have become vanity; in Gilgal they sacrifice bulls. Yes, their altars are like heaps of stones upon the furrows of the field.
And Jacob fled to the field of Aram, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept watch.
And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel up out of Egypt, and by a prophet he was guarded.
Ephraim has provoked to bitter anger; his bloodguilt shall be left upon him, and his reproach his Lord shall return to him.
When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling; he was exalted in Israel, but he incurred guilt through Baal and died.

And now they add to sin, and make for themselves a molten image from their silver, idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of craftsmen. Of them they say, “Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves.”
Therefore they shall be like the morning cloud, and like the dew that early passes away, like chaff whirled from the threshing floor, and like smoke from the window.
But I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt, and you shall know no god but Me, for there is no savior besides Me.
I knew you in the wilderness, in a land of burning drought.
According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was lifted up; therefore they forgot Me.
So I became to them like a lion; like a leopard I lie in wait by the way.
I will meet them like a bereaved bear, and I will tear open the enclosure of their heart; and there I will devour them like a lion, the wild beast of the field shall rend them.
You have destroyed yourself, O Israel, for in Me is your help.
Where now is your king, that he may save you in all your cities, and your judges of whom you said, “Give me a king and princes”?
I gave you a king in My anger, and I took him away in My wrath.
Bound up is the iniquity of Ephraim; laid up in store is his sin.
The pangs of a woman in labor come upon him; he is a son not wise, for at the time he should not stand in the breaking forth of children.
From the hand of Sheol I will ransom them, from death I will redeem them. O death, I will be your plagues; O Sheol, I will be your destruction. Compassion shall be hidden from My eyes.

For though he is fruitful among brothers, an east wind shall come, the wind of the LORD rising from the wilderness; his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up; he shall plunder the treasury of every precious vessel.
Samaria shall bear her guilt, for she has rebelled against her God; they shall fall by the sword, their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their pregnant women shall be ripped open.
Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God, for you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
Take with you words, and return to the LORD; say to Him, “Take away all iniquity and receive what is good, and we will render the bulls of our lips.”
Assyria shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses, and we will no more say to the work of our hands, “Our God,” for in you the orphan finds mercy.
I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely, for my anger has turned away from him.
I will be as the dew to Israel; he shall blossom as the lily, and cast forth his roots like Lebanon.
His young shoots shall spread, and his splendor shall be like the olive tree, and his fragrance like Lebanon.
Those who dwell in his shade shall return; they shall revive like grain and blossom like the vine; his renown shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
Ephraim, what have I still to do with idols? I, I have answered and will look upon him. I am like a green cypress; from Me your fruit is found.

Who is wise, that he may understand these things, and discerning, that he may know them? For the ways of the LORD are straight, and the righteous shall walk in them, but transgressors shall stumble in them.
